meanings.definition: A waterproof boot worn by sailors to protect their feet on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailor put on his seaboot before stepping onto the wet deck.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to wear your seaboot when sailing to keep your feet dry.
meanings.sent3: Why did the seaboot refuse to go near the puddle? It was afraid of getting wet!
meanings.sent4: Her seaboots were like shields, protecting her feet from the relentless sea.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow seaboot stood out against the dark, stormy waves.

meanings.definition: To put on or wear seaboots for sailing.
meanings.sent1: Before setting sail, the captain would seaboot himself for the journey.
meanings.sent2: Sailors seaboot before heading out to sea to stay comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to seaboot its paws with tiny boots, thinking it was a sailor.
meanings.sent4: As the wind picked up, he seabooted quickly to be ready for the rough waters.
meanings.sent5: Seabooting before sailing became a routine that he never skipped.
